DataElement.preferredName: Clinical Study Random Periareolar Fine-Needle Aspiration Performed Institution Stratification Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Classifying patients according to whether they belonged to health-related organizations that perform or do not perform RPFNA (procedure in which a fine needle is inserted in region around the areola to aspirate cells from the breast parenchyma for examination under a microscope to evaluate the short-term risk of developing breast cancer in women with a family history of breast cancer) to assure equal balance of these  patients before randomization to the intervention arms of a clinical protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Clinical Study Random Periareolar Fine-Needle Aspiration Performed Institution Stratification
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Classifying patients according to whether they belonged to health-related organizations that perform or do not perform RPFNA (procedure in which a fine needle is inserted in region around the areola to aspirate cells from the breast parenchyma for examination under a microscope to evaluate the short-term risk of developing breast cancer in women with a family history of breast cancer) to assure equal balance of these  patients before randomization to the intervention arms of a clinical protocol.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A type of research study that tests how well new medical treatments or other interventions work in people.  Such studies test new methods of screening, prevention, diagnosis, or treatment of a disease.  The study may be carried out in a clinic or other medical facility.  Also called a clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, study of mechanisms of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiologic, behavior, and health services research.

Property.preferredName: Random Periareolar Fine-Needle Aspiration Performed Institution Stratification
Property.preferredDefinition: A procedure in which a fine needle is inserted around the area of the areola to aspirate cells from the breast parenchyma and is used to evaluate the short-term risk of developing breast cancer in women with a family history of breast cancer.:Performed; carried out.:An established society, corporation, foundation or other organization founded and united for a specific purpose, e.g. for health-related research as, a literary institution; also, a building or the buildings occupied or used by such organization.:The process of classifying patients into strata as part of the randomization process or for purposes of data analysis.

Concepts.definition: A procedure in which a fine needle is inserted around the area of the areola to aspirate cells from the breast parenchyma and is used to evaluate the short-term risk of developing breast cancer in women with a family history of breast cancer.
Executed and carried through to completion.

An established society, corporation, foundation or other organization founded and united for a specific purpose, e.g. for health-related research; also used to refer to a building or buildings occupied or used by such organization.
The process of classifying patients into a sequence of grades or ranks as part of the randomization process or for purposes of data analysis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: CALGB CRF:Cancer and Leukemia Group B Case Report Form

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.
